patterns.name: Criticism-Defensiveness Cycle
patterns.description: One partner expresses concerns in ways perceived as criticism, triggering defensiveness in the other, which then reinforces the original concern.
sequence: Participant A notices issue and makes request
Participant A feels unheard and increases intensity
patterns.impact: Creates distance, unresolved issues accumulate, both feel misunderstood

progress.observation: First successful pattern interruption during discussion about weekend plans
progress.approach: Alex recognized defensive response and paused before responding

participant1.listeningStyle: Attentive but can become frustrated with perceived avoidance
participant1.emotionalExpression: Openly expresses frustration, less comfortable with vulnerability
participant1.conflictApproach: Engaging, prefers to address issues immediately

participant2.listeningStyle: Can become defensive when feeling criticized
participant2.conflictApproach: Initially avoiding, needs time to process

mismatches.description: Participant A prefers immediate addressing of issues while Alex needs processing time
mismatches.impact: Creates perception of avoidance vs. pushing
adaptations: Clear timeframes for returning to discussions

mismatches.description: Participant A notices household needs earlier than Alex
mismatches.impact: Creates imbalance in who initiates household maintenance

improvements.description: Participant A has begun using more collaborative language when discussing household tasks
improvements.impact: Reduced defensive responses from Alex by approximately 50%

improvements.description: Alex has practiced reflecting back concerns before responding
improvements.impact: Participant A reports feeling more understood even when immediate resolution isn't possible
